markdown.headingText: Add R files to source here
markdown.markdown:
```{r}

library(tidyverse)
library(Hmisc)
library(emmeans)
library(ragg)
library(SummarizedExperiment)
library(ComplexHeatmap)
library(gt)
library(nlme)
library(openxlsx)
library(factoextra)
library(gridExtra)
library(here)

```

Settings

```{r}
#| label: load
#| 
quarto_path <- here::here("code", "quarto-vis")

source(here::here(quarto_path, "R", "markdown.r"), local = knitr::knit_global())

# function to help with captioning
fig_caption <- captioner()
set.seed(1)

# set some options for the quarto
knitr::opts_chunk$set(warning=FALSE, error=FALSE, message=FALSE,
                      dev=c("ragg_png","pdf"), out.width="100%",
                      fig.width=14, fig.height=10,
                      results='asis', fig.cap=expression(fig_caption())
                      )
link2path <- function(lname) {  file.path(knitr::opts_knit$get("output.dir"),lname) }

```



```{r}
#| label: load2


# load the parameters stated at top of document
params_meta <- load_params(here::here(quarto_path, "resources", "Serology"), extra=TRUE)

counter <- (function(maxlen=3) {
  n <- 0
  function() {
    n <<- n+1
    sprintf(paste0("%0.", maxlen, "i"),n)
  }
})()

sero_SDY296 <- read.csv(file = here::here(params_meta$input_file))

```


`Covert HAI to log2 scale`

```{r}
#| label: standardise

sero_SDY296 <- sero_SDY296 %>% mutate(value_log2 = log2(value_preferred/5))

```



# Plotting serology 

## Post-vaccine antibody kinetics

:::{.panel-tabset}
### HAI titres


```{r}

assay_label <- "HAI"
assay_name <- "HAI"

sero_SDY296 %>% filter(assay == !!assay_label) %>% 
    ggplot() + 
        geom_count(aes(x = study_time_collected, y = 2^value_log2), fill = "gray", shape = 21) + 
        geom_line(aes(x = study_time_collected, y = 2^value_log2, group = subject_accession), alpha = 0.2) + 
        stat_summary(aes(x = study_time_collected, y = 2^value_log2), 
            fun = "mean", geom = "line", color = "red", size = 2, alpha = 0.8) +
        stat_summary(aes(x = study_time_collected, y = 2^value_log2), 
            fun = "mean", geom = "point", fill = "red", size = 4, shape = 21, alpha = 0.8) +
        facet_wrap(vars(virus_strain_preferred)) + 
        theme_bw() + 
        guides(size = "none") +
        labs(x = "Time post vaccination", y = paste0(assay_name, " assay titre" ) ) +
        scale_y_continuous(trans = "log2") +
        theme(text = element_text(size = 15))


```

### Neutralisation titres


```{r}

assay_label <- "Neut"
assay_name <- "Neutralisation"

sero_SDY296 %>% filter(assay == !!assay_label) %>% 
    ggplot() + 
        geom_count(aes(x = study_time_collected, y = 2^value_log2), fill = "gray", shape = 21) + 
        geom_line(aes(x = study_time_collected, y = 2^value_log2, group = subject_accession), alpha = 0.2) + 
        stat_summary(aes(x = study_time_collected, y = 2^value_log2), 
            fun = "mean", geom = "line", color = "red", size = 2, alpha = 0.8) +
        stat_summary(aes(x = study_time_collected, y = 2^value_log2), 
            fun = "mean", geom = "point", fill = "red", size = 4, shape = 21, alpha = 0.8) +
        facet_wrap(vars(virus_strain_preferred)) + 
        theme_bw() + 
        guides(size = "none") +
        labs(x = "Time post vaccination",  y = paste0(assay_name, " assay titre" ) ) +
        scale_y_continuous(trans = "log2") +
        theme(text = element_text(size = 15))


```

:::
markdown.srcMarkdownNoYaml:
```{r}

library(tidyverse)
library(Hmisc)
library(emmeans)
library(ragg)
library(SummarizedExperiment)
library(ComplexHeatmap)
library(gt)
library(nlme)
library(openxlsx)
library(factoextra)
library(gridExtra)
library(here)

```

Settings

```{r}
#| label: load
#| 
quarto_path <- here::here("code", "quarto-vis")

# Add R files to source here
source(here::here(quarto_path, "R", "markdown.r"), local = knitr::knit_global())

# function to help with captioning
fig_caption <- captioner()
set.seed(1)

# set some options for the quarto
knitr::opts_chunk$set(warning=FALSE, error=FALSE, message=FALSE,
                      dev=c("ragg_png","pdf"), out.width="100%",
                      fig.width=14, fig.height=10,
                      results='asis', fig.cap=expression(fig_caption())
                      )
link2path <- function(lname) {  file.path(knitr::opts_knit$get("output.dir"),lname) }

```



```{r}
#| label: load2


# load the parameters stated at top of document
params_meta <- load_params(here::here(quarto_path, "resources", "Serology"), extra=TRUE)

counter <- (function(maxlen=3) {
  n <- 0
  function() {
    n <<- n+1
    sprintf(paste0("%0.", maxlen, "i"),n)
  }
})()

sero_SDY296 <- read.csv(file = here::here(params_meta$input_file))

```
